It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
